```{python}
# --- Create Concat df ---
# import packages
import pandas as pd
import glob
import os

# assign R variable to python
fp_fastr = r.fp_fastr

# set path
path = os.getenv('USERPROFILE')+'/'+fp_fastr+'WQ_Subteam/Processed_Data/Continuous/'

# grab file paths
all_files = glob.glob(os.path.join(path, '*.csv'))

# import/concat files
df_each_file = (pd.read_csv(f, dtype = str) for f in all_files)
df_concat = pd.concat(df_each_file, ignore_index = True)

# export
df_concat.to_csv(path+'combined_files/combined_all.csv', index_col = False)
```

```{r}
# --- Import Data ---
# define main FASTR filepath (assumes sync'd with Sharepoint)
fp_fastr <- 'California Department of Water Resources/Office of Water Quality and Estuarine Ecology - North Delta Flow Action/'

# define relative filepaths 
fp_rel_wq <- paste(fp_fastr,'WQ_Subteam/Processed_Data/Continuous/', sep = '')
fp_rel_dates <- paste(fp_fastr,'Data Management/FlowDatesDesignations.csv', sep = '')

# define absolute filepaths
fp_abs_wq <- get_abs_path(fp_rel_wq)
fp_abs_dates <- get_abs_path(fp_rel_dates)

# import dates df
df_dates <- read_csv(fp_abs_dates)

# grab WQ filenames
filenames <- list.files(fp_abs_wq, pattern = '*.csv')

# import first 11 WQ .csvs
setwd(fp_abs_wq)

first_files <- ldply(filenames[1:11], read_csv)

# import last .csvs
last_files <- ldply(filenames[12:13], read_csv)

# --- Set Date Formats ---
# convert first_files to POSIXct
first_files$DateTime <- as.POSIXct(first_files$DateTime, '%Y/%m/%d %H:%M:%S')

# convert last_files to POSIXct
last_files$DateTime <- as.POSIXct(strptime(last_files$DateTime, '%m/%d/%Y %H:%M'), '%m/%d/%Y %H:%M')
last_files$DateTime <- as.POSIXct(format(last_files$DateTime, '%Y/%m/%d %H:%M:%S'),'%Y/%m/%d %H:%M:%S')

# --- Bind dfs ---
all_files <- rbind.fill(first_files, last_files)

# --- Clean df ---
# add date and time cols
all_files$Date <- as.Date(all_files$DateTime, '%Y/%m/%d %H:%M:%S', tz = '')
all_files$Year <- format(all_files$Date,'%Y')

# combine df
df_flow <- add_phase_actions(all_files, df_dates)

```
